conflictDescription: User Story A requires ALFRED to block all non-emergency notifications during work hours, while User Story B requires ALFRED to show notifications by client and allow the informal caregiver to choose which to accept. These are opposite instructions on handling notifications.
userStoryASummary: As a medical caregiver, I want ALFRED to block all non-emergency notifications during my work hours, so I can focus fully on patient care without distractions.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to see notifications by client and choose which to accept, so I can stay clear and respond well.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to include context-aware notification control during work hours, allowing emergency notifications to go through and informal caregivers to manage non-emergency notifications outside those hours.
newUserStoryASummary: As a medical caregiver, I want ALFRED to block non-emergency notifications during my work hours, so I can focus on patient care without distractions.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to see and manage non-emergency notifications outside work hours, so I can respond clearly and well.

conflictDescription: User Story A wants to block all non-emergency alerts during work hours, while User Story B wants to receive all notifications anytime, including non-urgent ones. These impose opposite behaviors on the system for the same event of sending non-emergency notifications.
userStoryASummary: As a busy nurse, I want ALFRED to block all non-emergency alerts during work hours so I can focus on urgent patient care without distractions.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to receive all ALFRED notifications anytime, including non-urgent ones, so I can stay ready to help my clients.
resolutionDescription: Apply a context-aware rule that blocks non-emergency alerts during work hours for busy caregivers while allowing informal caregivers to receive all notifications outside work hours or in emergencies.
newUserStoryASummary: As a busy nurse, I want ALFRED to block all non-emergency alerts during work hours so I can focus on urgent patient care without distractions.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to receive all ALFRED notifications outside work hours and emergency alerts anytime, so I can stay ready to help my clients.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires ALFRED to block all notifications during work hours, while User Story B requires ALFRED to send all notifications anytime, including during those hours. These opposite instructions cannot be satisfied at the same time under the same condition.
userStoryASummary: As a medical caregiver, I want ALFRED to block all notifications during my work hours so I can focus without distractions.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to receive all ALFRED notifications anytime, including non-urgent ones, so I can stay ready to help my clients.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to define specific notification rules that consider work hours and notification urgency, balancing focus and readiness.
newUserStoryASummary: As a medical caregiver, I want ALFRED to block non-urgent notifications during my work hours so I can focus without distractions.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to receive urgent ALFRED notifications anytime, including during work hours, so I can be ready to help.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires ALFRED to block all notifications during work hours, while User Story B requires ALFRED to send all notifications anytime. They give opposite instructions for the same event of notification delivery.
userStoryASummary: As a medical caregiver, I want ALFRED to block all notifications during my work hours to avoid distractions and interruptions.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to receive all ALFRED notifications anytime, including non-urgent ones, so I can stay ready to help my clients.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to include context-aware notification rules that respect work hours for caregivers and ensure critical notifications are still delivered to informal caregivers anytime.
newUserStoryASummary: As a medical caregiver, I want ALFRED to block non-urgent notifications during my work hours to avoid distractions but allow urgent alerts.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to receive all urgent ALFRED notifications anytime and non-urgent ones outside work hours to stay ready to help.

conflictDescription: User Story A wants to access all patient data without permission, but User Story B wants to turn off automatic data logging to protect privacy. These are opposite operations about data access and recording triggered by the same system context.
userStoryASummary: As a medical caregiver, I want to access all patient health data without their permission to provide fast and effective care.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to turn off automatic data logging and pick what is recorded to protect my clients' privacy.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to balance patient data access with privacy protection by adding consent and selective logging features.
newUserStoryASummary: As a medical caregiver, I want to access patient health data with their consent to provide effective care quickly.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to manage automatic data logging preferences to protect clients' privacy.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires the system to allow access to all patient health data without permission, while User Story B requires the system to allow manual control to share data only when chosen. These are opposite instructions on data access triggered by the same event of needing patient data.
userStoryASummary: As a medical caregiver, I want to access all patient health data without their permission to provide fast and effective care.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to choose when to share each client's data, so I can protect their privacy and keep control.
resolutionDescription: The conflict is resolved by defining clear roles and contexts: medical caregivers have controlled access for urgent care, while informal caregivers manage sharing in non-urgent situations.
newUserStoryASummary: As a medical caregiver, I want controlled access to patient health data in emergencies to provide fast and effective care.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to manage when to share client data for privacy and control in daily care.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires access to all patient data without privacy blocks, while User Story B wants to turn off automatic data logging to protect privacy, effectively forbidding data collection. These two requirements conflict because one mandates full data access and the other forbids data recording.
userStoryASummary: As a medical caregiver, I want to access all patient data without privacy blocks, so I can provide care quickly and without delays.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to turn off automatic data logging and pick what is recorded to protect my clients' privacy.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to balance data access and privacy by allowing selective data logging and controlled access to patient information.
newUserStoryASummary: As a medical caregiver, I want controlled access to patient data with privacy respect, so I can provide timely and safe care.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to select what data is logged and limit automatic recording, so that privacy is protected.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires the system to allow full access to patient data without privacy blocks, while User Story B requires the system to allow caregivers to manually control when to share data, effectively blocking access by default. These are opposite instructions for data access control.
userStoryASummary: As a medical caregiver, I want to access all patient data without privacy blocks, so I can provide care quickly and without delays.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to choose when to share each client's data, so I can protect their privacy and keep control.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: The informal caregiver's user story is updated to allow manual sharing control within privacy rules, while the medical caregiver's story remains to enable quick access under authorized conditions.
newUserStoryASummary: As a medical caregiver, I want to access patient data quickly when authorized, so I can provide timely care.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to manually control sharing of client data within privacy settings, so I can protect their privacy.

conflictDescription: User Story A wants ALFRED to enforce medication reminders automatically without asking, which means strong reminders. User Story B wants to send gentle reminders to avoid stress. These are opposite ways of reminding for the same event and operation.
userStoryASummary: As a medical caregiver, I want ALFRED to enforce medication reminders without asking patients, so they take medicine on time.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to send gentle medication reminders to my clients so I can help their health without making them feel stressed.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to allow ALFRED to adjust reminder strength based on user stress levels and preferences, balancing enforcement and gentleness.
newUserStoryASummary: As a medical caregiver, I want ALFRED to send medication reminders that adjust in strength, so patients take medicine on time without feeling stressed.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want ALFRED to provide gentle medication reminders that can become stronger if needed, so clients stay healthy and feel comfortable.
